content: A well-known children's novel by Frances Hodgson Burnett tells the story of Mary Lennox and her discovery of what secret outdoor space?

The well-known children's novel by Frances Hodgson Burnett that features the story of Mary Lennox and her discovery of a secret outdoor space is "The Secret Garden." In this classic novel, Mary, a young girl who has been raised by servants in India, is sent to live with her uncle Archibald Craven at Misselthwaite Manor in England after both of her parents die in a cholera epidemic. At the manor, Mary stumbles upon the existence of a walled garden that has been locked and left to nature for years, following the death of Archibald's wife. The garden becomes a symbol of hope and transformation as Mary, along with her new friends, sets out to restore it to its former glory, paralleling their own personal growth and healing.
